title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Software Developer and Engineer

content.rendered:
What is a Software Developer and Engineer?

Software Developers and Engineers create and develop software and software applications by applying the principles of engineering. They design, test, and upkeep software systems.

Where does a Software Developer and Engineer work?

  • Tech companies
  • Electronic product manufacturers
  • Computer design firms

How much does a Software Developer and Engineer make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Software Developer and Engineer is $90,646.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Software Developers and Engineers?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Software engineering majors
  • Computer science majors
  • General engineering majors
Search Software Developer and Engineer job opportunities on Handshake.

Software Developer and Engineer skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Software Developers and Engineers succeed in their work:

  • Relevant programming languages
  • Cloud computing skills
  • Project management

What are some common questions about Software Developers and Engineers?

Q: Are software engineers and developers the same role?

A: Not quite. Software engineers are more concerned with applying principles of engineering to make software. Software developers are concerned with the process of creation as a whole.

excerpt.rendered: Learn about the average salary, relevant studies, and common path after college to becoming a Software Developer and Engineer.
